title: Rotational inertia - two spheres on a rod

content.question: Two spheres, with masses <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> and <math alttext="3.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, are mounted on a <math alttext="3.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> long rod of negligible mass at the locations shown in the figure. The rotational inertia of the spheres-rod system about the left end of the rod is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="1.3 kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
